before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ess0","text":"Note on standards compliance: Simply following this template does not guarantee the same degree of compliance with all steps of the SR protocol development process. This is because some steps not only require something to be done, but for it to be done well. Compare, for example, selecting team members to fill competencies (step 2) with defining \"appropriate\" eligibility criteria (step 9). Author teams are recommended to implement some form of external auditing in their protocol development process, to help ensure that the planned methods are robust (see step 27).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1iknj","text":"This general protocol is designed to support the planning of SRs that are concerned with the effects of environmental exposures on human health outcomes, or the prevention or mitigation thereof.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekdrg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nbpd","text":"It has been designed specifically to help researchers follow the COSTER recommendations for the conduct of systematic reviews, in a way that complies with the ROSES and PRISMA-P checklists for reporting SR protocols, PRISMA-S for search strategies, and provides data for PROSPERO records.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":22}],"data":{}},{"key":"3mp3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3av5k","text":"Note that due to some inconsistencies between the standards and checklists, not every element of every checklist is covered. A cross-walk of the standards and checklists will be provided with forthcoming protocol documentation. Code is being written to help generate automated draft protocol reports.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14fea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atbq9","text":"If you use the protocol in a systematic review, please cite not only this instance of the protocol template, but also the parent COSTER manuscript, DOI 10.1016/j.envint.2020.105926.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":152,"length":28}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ir0e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tdn1","text":"Training in use of the protocol is available, and comments are welcome. Please contact the author, Paul Whaley, for more information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2CA93420C77C11EAA517339B620DF997","url":"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S016041202031881X"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"11EAA989C77C11EAADF50A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://doi.org/10.1016/j.envint.2020.105926"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"afl18","text":"Protocols.io has not yet been optimised as a means for reporting what was done in response to complex instructions such as those found in this protocol. Feedback on use of the protocol, and how to develop it to facilitate reporting of planned methods, would be very much appreciated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
